3.4.5.name: Joomla 1.5.0-3.4.5 - Object Injection RCE
3.4.5.description: Joomla versions 1.5.0 through 3.4.5 are vulnerable to a PHP object injection vulnerability leading to remote code execution.
3.4.5.impact: An unauthenticated attacker can execute arbitrary code on the server.
3.4.5.recommendation: Update Joomla to version 3.4.6 or later.

3.6.3.name: Joomla 3.4.4-3.6.3 - Account Creation Vulnerability
3.6.3.description: Joomla versions 3.4.4 through 3.6.3 are vulnerable to an account creation vulnerability.
3.6.3.impact: An unauthenticated attacker can create accounts with elevated privileges on the site.
3.6.3.recommendation: Update Joomla to version 3.6.4 or later.

3.7.0.name: Joomla 3.7.0 - SQL Injection
3.7.0.description: Joomla version 3.7.0 is vulnerable to a SQL injection vulnerability in the com_fields component.
3.7.0.impact: An unauthenticated attacker can execute arbitrary SQL queries, potentially leading to database access or modification.
3.7.0.recommendation: Update Joomla to version 3.7.1 or later.

3.8.3.name: Joomla 3.7.0-3.8.3 - Arbitrary File Delete
3.8.3.description: Joomla versions 3.7.0 through 3.8.3 are vulnerable to an arbitrary file deletion vulnerability.
3.8.3.impact: An authenticated attacker with admin privileges can delete arbitrary files on the server.
3.8.3.recommendation: Update Joomla to version 3.8.4 or later.

3.9.4.name: Joomla 3.0.0-3.9.4 - Directory Traversal
3.9.4.description: Joomla versions 3.0.0 through 3.9.4 are vulnerable to a directory traversal vulnerability in the Media Manager component.
3.9.4.impact: An authenticated attacker with admin privileges can access files outside the intended directory.
3.9.4.recommendation: Update Joomla to version 3.9.5 or later.

3.9.19.name: Joomla 3.0.0-3.9.19 - Improper Input Validation
3.9.19.description: Joomla versions 3.0.0 through 3.9.19 are vulnerable to an improper input validation vulnerability.
3.9.19.impact: An unauthenticated attacker can execute arbitrary code on the server.
3.9.19.recommendation: Update Joomla to version 3.9.20 or later.

3.10.0.name: Joomla 3.0.0-3.10.0 - Weak Password Reset
3.10.0.description: Joomla versions 3.0.0 through 3.10.0 are vulnerable to a weak password reset mechanism.
3.10.0.impact: An attacker can potentially reset user passwords due to insufficient entropy in the reset tokens.
3.10.0.recommendation: Update Joomla to version 3.10.1 or later.

4.0.3.name: Joomla 4.0.0-4.0.3 - XSS in Media Manager
4.0.3.description: Joomla versions 4.0.0 through 4.0.3 are vulnerable to a cross-site scripting vulnerability in the Media Manager component.
4.0.3.impact: An authenticated attacker can inject malicious JavaScript that would execute when an admin accesses the Media Manager.
4.0.3.recommendation: Update Joomla to version 4.0.4 or later.

4.1.1.name: Joomla 4.0.0-4.1.1 - CSRF in User Management
4.1.1.description: Joomla versions 4.0.0 through 4.1.1 are vulnerable to a cross-site request forgery vulnerability in the user management component.
4.1.1.impact: An attacker can trick an admin into performing unintended actions on the user management interface.
4.1.1.recommendation: Update Joomla to version 4.1.2 or later.

3.5.1.name: Joomla com_contact <= 3.5.1 - SQL Injection
3.5.1.description: The com_contact component in Joomla versions up to 3.5.1 is vulnerable to a SQL injection vulnerability.
3.5.1.impact: An unauthenticated attacker can execute arbitrary SQL queries, potentially leading to database access or modification.
3.5.1.recommendation: Update Joomla to version 3.6.0 or later.

3.7.0.name: Joomla com_fields 3.7.0 - SQL Injection
3.7.0.description: The com_fields component in Joomla version 3.7.0 is vulnerable to a SQL injection vulnerability.
3.7.0.impact: An unauthenticated attacker can execute arbitrary SQL queries, potentially leading to database access or modification.
3.7.0.recommendation: Update Joomla to version 3.7.1 or later.

3.9.4.name: Joomla com_media <= 3.9.4 - Directory Traversal
3.9.4.description: The com_media component in Joomla versions up to 3.9.4 is vulnerable to a directory traversal vulnerability.
3.9.4.impact: An authenticated attacker with admin privileges can access files outside the intended directory.
3.9.4.recommendation: Update Joomla to version 3.9.5 or later.

4.0.3.name: Joomla com_media 4.0.0-4.0.3 - XSS
4.0.3.description: The com_media component in Joomla versions 4.0.0 through 4.0.3 is vulnerable to a cross-site scripting vulnerability.
4.0.3.impact: An authenticated attacker can inject malicious JavaScript that would execute when an admin accesses the Media Manager.
4.0.3.recommendation: Update Joomla to version 4.0.4 or later.

3.6.3.name: Joomla com_users 3.4.4-3.6.3 - Account Creation
3.6.3.description: The com_users component in Joomla versions 3.4.4 through 3.6.3 is vulnerable to an account creation vulnerability.
3.6.3.impact: An unauthenticated attacker can create accounts with elevated privileges on the site.
3.6.3.recommendation: Update Joomla to version 3.6.4 or later.

4.1.1.name: Joomla com_users 4.0.0-4.1.1 - CSRF
4.1.1.description: The com_users component in Joomla versions 4.0.0 through 4.1.1 is vulnerable to a cross-site request forgery vulnerability.
4.1.1.impact: An attacker can trick an admin into performing unintended actions on the user management interface.
4.1.1.recommendation: Update Joomla to version 4.1.2 or later.

3.1.0.name: Joomla mod_stats <= 3.1.0 - Information Disclosure
3.1.0.description: The mod_stats module in Joomla versions up to 3.1.0 is vulnerable to an information disclosure vulnerability.
3.1.0.impact: An unauthenticated attacker can access sensitive server information.
3.1.0.recommendation: Update Joomla to version 3.1.1 or later.

3.6.3.name: Joomla mod_menu <= 3.6.3 - XSS
3.6.3.description: The mod_menu module in Joomla versions up to 3.6.3 is vulnerable to a cross-site scripting vulnerability.
3.6.3.impact: An authenticated attacker can inject malicious JavaScript that would execute when the menu is viewed.
3.6.3.recommendation: Update Joomla to version 3.6.4 or later.

3.6.3.name: Joomla beez3 <= 3.6.3 - XSS
3.6.3.description: The beez3 template in Joomla versions up to 3.6.3 is vulnerable to a cross-site scripting vulnerability.
3.6.3.impact: An authenticated attacker can inject malicious JavaScript that would execute when the template is viewed.
3.6.3.recommendation: Update Joomla to version 3.6.4 or later.

3.6.3.name: Joomla protostar <= 3.6.3 - XSS
3.6.3.description: The protostar template in Joomla versions up to 3.6.3 is vulnerable to a cross-site scripting vulnerability.
3.6.3.impact: An authenticated attacker can inject malicious JavaScript that would execute when the template is viewed.
3.6.3.recommendation: Update Joomla to version 3.6.4 or later.
